translated_title: 马氏野马基因组的测序与组装教学实践
affiliations: Department of Animal Science, College of Food, Agricultural, and Natural Resource Sciences, University of Minnesota. Electronic address: cfaulk@umn.edu.
title: Sequencing and assembling the genome of Przewalski's horse in the classroom.
authors: Faulk Christopher
keywords: Genomics; Classroom science; DNA sequencing; Przewalski's horse
abstract: Sequencing a genome by students has now become practical as we demonstrated with our recent publication of the Przewalski's horse (Equus ferus przewalskii) genome. In this review, I describe my experience teaching genome assembly in the classroom. In my course, students sequenced, assembled, and published a high-quality genome for Przewalski's horse using Oxford Nanopore long-read sequencing with only $4000 of materials. Along with the genome, we assembled the mitochondrial genome, sequence variants, predicted gene annotations, and DNA methylation levels. Our genome statistics far exceeded the previous Przewalski's horse assembly and is on par the domestic horse genome, EquCab3.0. Methods were streamlined, simplified, and conveyed in markdown for complete recording and use in the classroom. All students were authors on the resulting manuscript. By bringing genome assembly into the classroom, we provide both new reference genomes and new genomics expertise to the scientific community at the same time.
translated_keywords: 基因组学；课堂科学；DNA测序；普氏野马
translated_abstract: 通过我们最近发表的普氏野马（*Equus ferus przewalskii*）基因组研究，学生进行基因组测序如今已成为现实。在这篇综述中，我描述了在课堂上教授基因组组装的经验。在我的课程中，学生们使用牛津纳米孔长读长测序技术，仅花费4000美元的材料成本，就完成了高质量的普氏野马基因组测序、组装和发表工作。此外，我们还组装了线粒体基因组、检测了序列变异、预测了基因注释，并分析了DNA甲基化水平。我们的基因组统计数据远远超过了之前的普氏野马基因组组装版本，并且与家马基因组（EquCab3.0）相当。所有方法均以Markdown格式记录并简化，便于在课堂中完整重现和应用。最终论文的所有学生均为作者。通过将基因组组装引入课堂，我们不仅提供了新的参考基因组，也为科学界培养了新的基因组学专业人才。

translated_title: 逐步细菌基因组比较
affiliations: Programa de Pós-Graduação Interunidades em Bioinformática, Instituto de Matemática e Estatística, Universidade de São Paulo, Sao Paulo, SP, Brazil.; Research Group in Biotechnology Applied to Animal Health, Production and Conservation (SANIGEN), Laboratory of Biology and Molecular Genetics, Faculty of Veterinary Medicine, Universidad Nacional Mayor de San Marcos, San Borja, Lima, Peru.; Departamento de Bioquímica, Instituto de Química, Universidade de São Paulo, Sao Paulo, SP, Brazil. setubal@iq.usp.br.
title: Step-by-Step Bacterial Genome Comparison.
authors: Carhuaricra-Huaman Dennis; Setubal João Carlos
keywords: Bacteria; Phylogenetic analysis; Pangenome; Comparative genomics
abstract: Thanks to advancements in genome sequencing and bioinformatics, thousands of bacterial genome sequences are available in public databases. This presents an opportunity to study bacterial diversity in unprecedented detail. This chapter describes a complete bioinformatics workflow for comparative genomics of bacterial genomes, including genome annotation, pangenome reconstruction and visualization, phylogenetic analysis, and identification of sequences of interest such as antimicrobial-resistance genes, virulence factors, and phage sequences. The workflow uses state-of-the-art, open-source tools. The workflow is presented by means of a comparative analysis of Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium genomes. The workflow is based on Linux commands and scripts, and result visualization relies on the R environment. The chapter provides a step-by-step protocol that researchers with basic expertise in bioinformatics can easily follow to conduct investigations on their own genome datasets.
translated_keywords: 细菌；系统发育分析；泛基因组；比较基因组学
translated_abstract: 由于基因组测序和生物信息学的进步，公共数据库中已有数千种细菌基因组序列可供使用，这为研究细菌多样性提供了前所未有的机会。本章描述了一种用于细菌基因组比较基因组学的完整生物信息学工作流程，包括基因组注释、泛基因组重构与可视化、系统发育分析以及目标序列（如抗微生物耐药基因、毒力因子和噬菌体序列）的鉴定。该工作流程采用了最先进的开源工具。通过鼠伤寒沙门氏菌基因组的比较分析展示了这一工作流程。该工作流程基于Linux命令和脚本，结果可视化依赖于R环境。本章提供了一个逐步协议，具有基础生物信息学知识的研究人员可以轻松遵循此协议来对自身的基因组数据集进行研究调查。

translated_title: 人口腔Gemella物种的位点特异性分布
affiliations: The Forsyth Institute, Cambridge, MA, USA.; Josephine Bay Paul Center for Comparative Molecular Biology and Evolution, Marine Biological Laboratory, Woods Hole, MA, USA.; Department of Oral Medicine, Infection and Immunity, Harvard School of Dental Medicine, Boston, MA, USA.
title: Site-specialization of human oral Gemella species.
authors: Torres-Morales Julian; Mark Welch Jessica L; Dewhirst Floyd E; Borisy Gary G
keywords: oral; metapangenome; microbiome; pangenome; metagenome; Gemella
abstract: Gemella species are core members of the human oral microbiome in healthy subjects and are regarded as commensals, although they can cause opportunistic infections. Our objective was to evaluate the site-specialization of Gemella species among various habitats within the mouth by combining pangenomics and metagenomics. With pangenomics, we identified genome relationships and categorized genes as core and accessory to each species. With metagenomics, we identified the primary oral habitat of individual genomes. Our results establish that the genomes of three species, G. haemolysans, G. sanguinis and G. morbillorum, are abundant and prevalent in human mouths at different oral sites: G. haemolysans on buccal mucosa and keratinized gingiva; G. sanguinis on tongue dorsum, throat, and tonsils; and G. morbillorum in dental plaque. The gene-level basis of site-specificity was investigated by identifying genes that were core to Gemella genomes at a specific oral site but absent from other Gemella genomes. The riboflavin biosynthesis pathway was present in G. haemolysans genomes associated with buccal mucosa but absent from the rest of the genomes. Overall, metapangenomics show that Gemella species have clear ecological preferences in the oral cavity of healthy humans and provides an approach to identifying gene-level drivers of site specificity.
translated_keywords: 口腔；宏pan基因组；微生物群；pan基因组；宏基因组；吉迈拉（或近似种属名）
translated_abstract: G. haemolysans 存在于颊粘膜和角化牙龈；G. sanguinis 存在于舌背、咽喉和扁桃体；而 G. morbillorum 存在于牙菌斑中。通过识别特定口腔部位核心但其他链球菌基因组中缺失的基因，研究了位点特异性的基因水平基础。核黄素生物合成途径存在于与颊粘膜相关的 G. haemolysans 基因组中，但在其余基因组中不存在。总体而言，元泛基因组学显示，链球菌属物种在健康人群口腔中有明确的生态偏好，并提供了一种识别位点特异性基因驱动因素的方法。

title: Comprehensive assembly and comparative examination of the full mitochondrial genome in Castanea mollissima Blume.
authors: Guo Haili; Liu Qiong; Chen Ying; Niu Hongyun; Zhao Qianru; Song Hui; Pang Ruidong; Huang Xiaolu; Zhang Jingzheng; Zhao Zhiheng; Liu Dan; Zhu Jingle
keywords: Mitochondrial genome; Castanea mollissima; Genomic recombination; Phylogenetic analysis; Molecular breeding
abstract: The Chinese chestnut, Castanea mollissima Blume, a nut-bearing tree native to China and North Korea, belongs to the Fagaceae family. As an important genetic resource, C. mollissima is vital in enhancing edible chestnut varieties and offers significant insights into the origin and evolution of chestnut species. While the chloroplast genome of C. mollissima has been sequenced, its mitochondrial genome (mitogenome) remains largely uncharted. In this study, we have characterized the C. mollissima mitogenome, assembling it utilizing reads from both BGI and Nanopore sequencing platforms, and conducted a comparative analysis with the mitochondrial genomes of closely related species. The mitogenome of C. mollissima manifests a polycyclic structure consisting of two circular molecules measuring 363,232 bp and 24,806 bp, respectively. This genome encompasses 35 unique protein-coding genes, 19 tRNA genes, and three rRNA genes. A total of 139 SSRs were identified throughout the entire C. mollissima mitogenome. Furthermore, the combined length of homologous fragments between the chloroplast and mitochondrial genomes was 5766 bp, constituting 1.49% of the mitogenome. We also predicted 484 RNA editing sites in C. mollissima, demonstrating C-to-U RNA editing. Phylogenetic analysis of related species' mitogenomes showed that C. mollissima was closely related to Lithocarpus litseifolius (Hance) Chun and Quercus acutissima Carruth. Interestingly, the mitogenome sequences of C. mollissima, L. litseifolius, Q. acutissima, Fagus sylvatica L., and Juglans mandshurica Maxim did not show conservation in their alignments, indicating frequent genome reorganization. This report marks the inaugural study of the C. mollissima mitogenome, serving as a benchmark genome for economically significant plants within the Castanea genus. Moreover, it supplies invaluable information that can guide future molecular breeding efforts and contribute to the broader understanding of chestnut genomics.
translated_keywords: 线粒体基因组；毛栗；基因组重组；系统发育分析；分子育种
translated_abstract: 板栗（*Castanea mollissima* Blume）是一种原产于中国和朝鲜半岛的壳斗科（Fagaceae）坚果树种，作为重要的遗传资源，在改良可食用栗品种以及揭示栗属物种起源与演化方面具有重要意义。尽管*Castanea mollissima*的叶绿体基因组已被测序，但其线粒体基因组（mitogenome）仍鲜有研究。本研究对*Castanea mollissima*的线粒体基因组进行了系统分析，利用BGI和Nanopore测序平台的读段进行组装，并与近缘物种的线粒体基因组进行了比较分析。结果表明，*C. mollissima*的线粒体基因组呈现多环结构，由两个大小分别为363,232 bp和24,806 bp的环状分子组成。该基因组包含35个独特的蛋白质编码基因、19个tRNA基因和3个rRNA基因。此外，全基因组中共鉴定出139个SSR（简单序列重复）。进一步分析发现，叶绿体与线粒体基因组之间的同源片段总长度为5,766 bp，占线粒体基因组的1.49%。通过预测，我们确定了*C. mollissima*中有484个RNA编辑位点，表现为C-to-U编辑。系统发育分析显示，*C. mollissima*与*Lithocarpus litseifolius*（Hance）Chun和*Quercus acutissima* Carruth亲缘关系较近。有趣的是，*C. mollissima*、*L. litseifolius*、*Q. acutissima*、*Fagus sylvatica* L.和*Juglans mandshurica* Maxim的线粒体基因组序列在比对中未表现出保守性，表明这些物种的线粒体基因组存在频繁的重组现象。本研究首次报道了*C. mollissima*的线粒体基因组，为栗属经济植物提供了基准基因组，同时为未来分子育种工作提供了重要信息，有助于更深入地理解栗属植物的基因组学特性。

translated_title: 长毛象适应性进化的基因组学

title: Genomics of adaptive evolution in the woolly mammoth.
authors: Díez-Del-Molino David; Dehasque Marianne; Chacón-Duque J Camilo; Pečnerová Patrícia; Tikhonov Alexei; Protopopov Albert; Plotnikov Valeri; Kanellidou Foteini; Nikolskiy Pavel; Mortensen Peter; Danilov Gleb K; Vartanyan Sergey; Gilbert M Thomas P; Lister Adrian M; Heintzman Peter D; van der Valk Tom; Dalén Love
keywords: genome; genes; Mammuthus primigenius; selection; non-synonymous mutations; adaptation
abstract: Ancient genomes provide a tool to investigate the genetic basis of adaptations in extinct organisms. However, the identification of species-specific fixed genetic variants requires the analysis of genomes from multiple individuals. Moreover, the long-term scale of adaptive evolution coupled with the short-term nature of traditional time series data has made it difficult to assess when different adaptations evolved. Here, we analyze 23 woolly mammoth genomes, including one of the oldest known specimens at 700,000 years old, to identify fixed derived non-synonymous mutations unique to the species and to obtain estimates of when these mutations evolved. We find that at the time of its origin, the woolly mammoth had already acquired a broad spectrum of positively selected genes, including ones associated with hair and skin development, fat storage and metabolism, and immune system function. Our results also suggest that these phenotypes continued to evolve during the last 700,000 years, but through positive selection on different sets of genes. Finally, we also identify additional genes that underwent comparatively recent positive selection, including multiple genes related to skeletal morphology and body size, as well as one gene that may have contributed to the small ear size in Late Quaternary woolly mammoths.
translated_keywords: 基因组；基因；猛犸象（Mammuthus primigenius）；选择；非同义突变；适应
translated_abstract: 古代基因组为研究已灭绝生物的适应遗传基础提供了一种工具。然而，识别物种特有的固定遗传变异需要分析多个个体的基因组。此外，适应性进化的长期尺度与传统时间序列数据的短期性质相结合，使得评估不同适应性特征的进化时间变得困难。本文对23头猛犸象基因组进行了分析，其中包括已知最古老的猛犸象样本之一，距今约70万年，以识别该物种特有的固定衍生非同义突变，并估算这些突变的进化时间。我们发现，在猛犸象起源时，其基因组已经获得了广泛的正选择基因，包括与毛发和皮肤发育、脂肪存储与代谢以及免疫系统功能相关的基因。我们的结果还表明，这些表型在过去的70万年中继续进化，但通过作用于不同的基因集。最后，我们还确定了其他经历了相对较近期正选择的基因，其中包括多个与骨骼形态和体型相关的基因，以及一个可能与更新世晚期猛犸象小耳尺寸相关的基因。

translated_title: 基因组、泛基因组及更多内容
affiliations: Department of Plant Science and Landscape Architecture, University of Maryland, College Park, MD 20742, USA. Electronic address: vktiwari@umd.edu.; Department of Plant Science and Landscape Architecture, University of Maryland, College Park, MD 20742, USA; Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, Pee Dee Research and Education Center, Clemson University, Florence, SC 29506, USA.; Department of Plant Science and Landscape Architecture, University of Maryland, College Park, MD 20742, USA.; Plant Science Program, Biological and Environmental Science and Engineering Division, King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST), Thuwal 23955-6900, Saudi Arabia.
title: Wheat genomics: genomes, pangenomes, and beyond.
authors: Tiwari Vijay K; Saripalli Gautam; Sharma Parva K; Poland Jesse
keywords: genomics; IWGSC; wheat; genes; traits; pangenome; genomes
abstract: There is an urgent need to improve wheat for upcoming challenges, including biotic and abiotic stresses. Sustainable wheat improvement requires the introduction of new genes and alleles in high-yielding wheat cultivars. Using new approaches, tools, and technologies to identify and introduce new genes in wheat cultivars is critical. High-quality genomes, transcriptomes, and pangenomes provide essential resources and tools to examine wheat closely to identify and manipulate new and targeted genes and alleles. Wheat genomics has improved excellently in the past 5 years, generating multiple genomes, pangenomes, and transcriptomes. Leveraging these resources allows us to accelerate our crop improvement pipelines. This review summarizes the progress made in wheat genomics and trait discovery in the past 5 years.
translated_keywords: 基因组学；国际小麦基因组测序联盟；小麦；基因；性状；泛基因组；基因组
translated_abstract: 亟需通过改良小麦来应对即将到来的挑战，包括生物和非生物胁迫。可持续的小麦改良需要在高产小麦品种中引入新基因和等位基因。采用新的方法、工具和技术来识别并引入小麦中的新基因至关重要。高质量的基因组、转录组和泛基因组提供了必要的资源和工具，以深入研究小麦，从而识别并操作新目标基因和等位基因。过去五年，小麦基因组学取得了显著进步，生成了多个基因组、泛基因组和转录组。利用这些资源可以加速我们的作物改良流程。本文综述了过去五年在小麦基因组学和性状发现方面取得的进展。

translated_title: 葡萄基因组学的野性一面
affiliations: Department of Viticulture and Enology, University of California, Davis, Davis, CA 95616, USA; Genome Center, University of California, Davis, Davis, CA 95616, USA. Electronic address: dacantu@ucdavis.edu.; Department of Viticulture and Enology, University of California, Davis, Davis, CA 95616, USA.
title: The wild side of grape genomics.
authors: Cantu Dario; Massonnet Mélanie; Cochetel Noé
keywords: flower sex determination; haplotype phasing; disease resistance; pangenome; diploid genome assembly
abstract: With broad genetic diversity and as a source of key agronomic traits, wild grape species (Vitis spp.) are crucial to enhance viticulture's climatic resilience and sustainability. This review discusses how recent breakthroughs in the genome assembly and analysis of wild grape species have led to discoveries on grape evolution, from wild species' adaptation to environmental stress to grape domestication. We detail how diploid chromosome-scale genomes from wild Vitis spp. have enabled the identification of candidate disease-resistance and flower sex determination genes and the creation of the first Vitis graph-based pangenome. Finally, we explore how wild grape genomics can impact grape research and viticulture, including aspects such as data sharing, the development of functional genomics tools, and the acceleration of genetic improvement.
translated_keywords: 花性别决定；单倍型 phased 分析；抗病性；泛基因组；二倍体基因组组装
translated_abstract: 由于具有广泛的遗传多样性和关键农艺性状的来源，野生葡萄种（Vitis spp.）对提升葡萄栽培的气候适应力和可持续性至关重要。本文综述了近期在野生葡萄种基因组组装与分析方面的突破如何推动了关于葡萄演化的新发现，从野生种对环境胁迫的适应到葡萄驯化过程。我们详细阐述了来自野生Vitis spp. 的二倍体染色体规模基因组如何助力候选抗病基因和花性别决定基因的鉴定，并促成了首个基于图模型的葡萄泛基因组的构建。最后，我们探讨了野生葡萄基因组学如何影响葡萄研究和葡萄栽培，包括数据共享、功能基因组学工具开发以及加速遗传改良等方面的内容。

translated_title: 利用DNA分子标记、基因组选择和基因组编辑
affiliations: ICAR Research Complex for NEH Region, Tripura Centre, Lembucherra, Agartala, 799210, Tripura, India. rshah1775@gmail.com.; ICAR-National Research Centre for Orchids, Pakyong, Sikkim, India.; ICAR Research Complex for NEH Region, Tripura Centre, Lembucherra, Agartala, 799210, Tripura, India.; ICAR Research Complex for NEH Region, Umiam, 793103, Meghalaya, India.; ICAR-Central Soil Salinity Research Institute, Karnal, India.; ICAR-National Rice Research Institute, Cuttack, 753006, Odisha, India.; ICAR -Krishi Vigyan Kendra, Tamenglong District, Manipur, India.; Department of Food Science and Technology, College of Agriculture, G.B.P.U.A.&T., Pantnagar, India.
title: Advances in genomic tools for plant breeding: harnessing DNA molecular markers, genomic selection, and genome editing.
authors: Kumar Rahul; Das Sankar Prasad; Choudhury Burhan Uddin; Kumar Amit; Prakash Nitish Ranjan; Verma Ramlakhan; Chakraborti Mridul; Devi Ayam Gangarani; Bhattacharjee Bijoya; Das Rekha; Das Bapi; Devi H Lembisana; Das Biswajit; Rawat Santoshi; Mishra Vinay Kumar
keywords: Plant breeding; Genomic resources; Genomic selection; Molecular markers; CRISPR-Cas9; Genomic tools
abstract: Conventional pre-genomics breeding methodologies have significantly improved crop yields since the mid-twentieth century. Genomics provides breeders with advanced tools for whole-genome study, enabling a direct genotype-phenotype analysis. This shift has led to precise and efficient crop development through genomics-based approaches, including molecular markers, genomic selection, and genome editing. Molecular markers, such as SNPs, are crucial for identifying genomic regions linked to important traits, enhancing breeding accuracy and efficiency. Genomic resources viz. genetic markers, reference genomes, sequence and protein databases, transcriptomes, and gene expression profiles, are vital in plant breeding and aid in the identification of key traits, understanding genetic diversity, assist in genomic mapping, support marker-assisted selection and speeding up breeding programs. Advanced techniques like CRISPR/Cas9 allow precise gene modification, accelerating breeding processes. Key techniques like Genome-Wide Association study (GWAS), Marker-Assisted Selection (MAS), and Genomic Selection (GS) enable precise trait selection and prediction of breeding outcomes, improving crop yield, disease resistance, and stress tolerance. These tools are handy for complex traits influenced by multiple genes and environmental factors. This paper explores new genomic technologies like molecular markers, genomic selection, and genome editing for plant breeding showcasing their impact on developing new plant varieties.
translated_keywords: 植物育种；基因组资源；基因组选择；分子标记；CRISPR-Cas9；基因组学工具
translated_abstract: 自20世纪中叶以来，传统的基因组学前育种方法显著提高了作物产量。基因组学为育种者提供了全基因组研究的先进工具，使得直接进行基因型与表型分析成为可能。这一转变通过基于基因组学的方法（包括分子标记、基因组选择和基因组编辑）实现了作物开发的精确性和高效性。例如，单核苷酸多态性（SNP）等分子标记对于识别与重要性状相关的基因组区域至关重要，从而提高育种的准确性与效率。基因组资源，如遗传标记、参考基因组、序列和蛋白质数据库、转录组以及基因表达谱，在植物育种中具有重要作用，有助于识别关键性状、理解遗传多样性、辅助基因组作图、支持标记辅助选择并加速育种计划。先进的技术如CRISPR/Cas9允许精确的基因修饰，从而加速育种过程。全基因组关联研究（GWAS）、标记辅助选择（MAS）和基因组选择（GS）等关键技术能够实现性状的精准选择和育种结果的预测，从而改善作物产量、抗病性和抗逆性。这些工具在受多个基因和环境因素影响的复杂性状育种中尤为实用。本文探讨了分子标记、基因组选择和基因组编辑等新的基因组技术在植物育种中的应用及其对新品种开发的影响。

translated_title: 个性化泛基因组参考
affiliations: UC Santa Cruz Genomics Institute, University of California, Santa Cruz, 1156 High Street, Santa Cruz, CA 95064, USA.; University of Ferrara, Ferrara, via Fossato di Mortara 27, Ferrara, FE 44121, Italy.; Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheater Pkwy, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA.; Center for Cancer Research, National Cancer Institute, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD, USA.; Institut de Recherche en Santé Digestive, Université de Toulouse, INSERM, INRA, ENVT, UPS, Toulouse, France.
title: Personalized Pangenome References.
authors: Sirén Jouni; Eskandar Parsa; Ungaro Matteo Tommaso; Hickey Glenn; Eizenga Jordan M; Novak Adam M; Chang Xian; Chang Pi-Chuan; Kolmogorov Mikhail; Carroll Andrew; Monlong Jean; Paten Benedict
keywords: (Auto-generated) 个性化;泛基因组;参考偏倚;局部祖先推断;读映射;结构变异;基因分型;生物信息学;分子生物学
abstract: Pangenomes, by including genetic diversity, should reduce reference bias by better representing new samples compared to them. Yet when comparing a new sample to a pangenome, variants in the pangenome that are not part of the sample can be misleading, for example, causing false read mappings. These irrelevant variants are generally rarer in terms of allele frequency, and have previously been dealt with using allele frequency filters. However, this is a blunt heuristic that both fails to remove some irrelevant variants and removes many relevant variants. We propose a new approach, inspired by local ancestry inference methods, that imputes a personalized pangenome subgraph based on sampling local haplotypes according to k-mer counts in the reads. Our approach is tailored for the Giraffe short read aligner, as the indexes it needs for read mapping can be built quickly. We compare the accuracy of our approach to state-of-the-art methods using graphs from the Human Pangenome Reference Consortium. The resulting personalized pangenome pipelines provide faster pangenome read mapping than comparable pipelines that use a linear reference, reduce small variant genotyping errors by 4x relative to the Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) best-practice pipeline, and for the first time make short-read structural variant genotyping competitive with long-read discovery methods.
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
translated_keywords: 个性化;泛基因组;参考偏倚;局部祖先推断;读映射;结构变异;基因分型;生物信息学;分子生物学
journal_full_name: bioRxiv: The Preprint Server for Biology
translated_abstract: 泛基因组通过包含遗传多样性，应能通过更好地代表新样本来减少参考偏倚。然而，当将新样本与泛基因组进行比较时，泛基因组中存在的非样本相关变异可能会产生误导，例如导致错误的读段比对。这些无关变异通常在等位基因频率上较为稀有，并且以往通常使用等位基因频率过滤器来处理。然而，这是一种粗略的经验方法，既未能去除某些无关变异，又去除了许多相关变异。我们提出了一种新的方法，受局部祖先推断方法的启发，根据读段中的k-mer计数来采样局部单倍型，从而推断出个性化的泛基因组子图。我们的方法专为Giraffe短读比对器设计，因为其用于读段比对所需的索引可以快速构建。我们使用人类泛基因组参考联盟提供的图谱，将我们的方法与最先进的方法进行了比较。由此产生的个性化泛基因组流程比使用线性参考的可比流程提供了更快的泛基因组读段比对速度，相对于基因组分析工具包（GATK）的最佳实践流程，小变异基因分型错误减少了4倍，并首次使短读结构变异基因分型与长读发现方法具有竞争力。

translated_title: 泛基因组变异分析（PanVA）
title: PanVA: Pangenomic Variant Analysis.
authors: van den Brandt Astrid; Jonkheer Eef M; van Workum Dirk-Jan M; van de Wetering Huub; Smit Sandra; Vilanova Anna
keywords: (Auto-generated) 基因组变异;泛基因组;表型差异;可视化分析;基因型-表型关系;假设生成;多参考基因组;生物信息学;分子生物学
abstract: Genomics researchers increasingly use multiple reference genomes to comprehensively explore genetic variants underlying differences in detectable characteristics between organisms. Pangenomes allow for an efficient data representation of multiple related genomes and their associated metadata. However, current visual analysis approaches for exploring these complex genotype-phenotype relationships are often based on single reference approaches or lack adequate support for interpreting the variants in the genomic context with heterogeneous (meta)data. This design study introduces PanVA, a visual analytics design for pangenomic variant analysis developed with the active participation of genomics researchers. The design uniquely combines tailored visual representations with interactions such as sorting, grouping, and aggregation, allowing users to navigate and explore different perspectives on complex genotype-phenotype relations. Through evaluation in the context of plants and pathogen research, we show that PanVA helps researchers explore variants in genes and generate hypotheses about their role in phenotypic variation.
journal: IEEE transactions on visualization and computer graphics
translated_keywords: 基因组变异;泛基因组;表型差异;可视化分析;基因型-表型关系;假设生成;多参考基因组;生物信息学;分子生物学
translated_abstract: 基因组学研究人员越来越多地使用多个参考基因组来全面探索影响可检测特征差异背后的遗传变异。泛基因组允许高效表示多个相关基因组及其关联元数据。然而，目前用于探索这些复杂基因型-表型关系的可视化分析方法通常基于单一参考方法，或者缺乏在基因组背景下解释变异（包括异构化元数据）的充分支持。本设计研究介绍了PanVA，这是一种在基因组学研究人员积极参与下开发的泛基因组变异分析可视化分析设计。该设计独特地结合了定制化的可视化表示与排序、分组和聚合等交互方式，使用户能够从不同角度导航和探索复杂的基因型-表型关系。通过植物和病原体研究背景下的评估，我们表明PanVA有助于研究人员探索基因中的变异并生成关于其在表型变异中作用的假设。

translated_title: 泛基因组时代法医学人、动物和植物整合基因组的研究展望与机遇
affiliations: Institute of Rare Diseases, West China Hospital of Sichuan University, Sichuan University, Chengdu 610000, China; Center for Archaeological Science, Sichuan University, Chengdu 610000, China. Electronic address: guanglinhescu@163.com.; Anti-Drug Technology Center of Guangdong Province, Guangzhou 510230, China. title: Perspectives and opportunities in forensic human, animal, and plant integrative genomics in the Pangenome era.
authors: He Guanglin; Liu Chao; Wang Mengge
keywords: Genomic diversity; Long-read third-generation sequencing; Forensic integrative genomics; Paradigm shift; Pangenome reference
abstract: The Human Pangenome Reference Consortium, the Chinese Pangenome Consortium, and other plant and animal pangenome projects have announced the completion of pilot work aimed at constructing high-quality, haplotype-resolved reference graph genomes representative of global ethno-linguistically different populations or different plant and animal species. These graph-based, gapless pangenome references, which are enriched in terms of genomic diversity, completeness, and contiguity, have the potential for enhancing long-read sequencing (LRS)-based genomic research, as well as improving mappability and variant genotyping on traditional short-read sequencing platforms. We comprehensively discuss the advancements in pangenome-based genomic integrative genomic discoveries across forensic-related species (humans, animals, and plants) and summarize their applications in variant identification and forensic genomics, epigenetics, transcriptomics, and microbiome research. Recent developments in multiplexed array sequencing have introduced a highly efficient and programmable technique to overcome the limitations of short forensic marker lengths in LRS platforms. This technique enables the concatenation of short RNA transcripts and DNA fragments into LRS-optimal molecules for sequencing, assembly, and genotyping. The integration of new pangenome reference coordinates and corresponding computational algorithms will benefit forensic integrative genomics by facilitating new marker identification, accurate genotyping, high-resolution panel development, and the updating of statistical algorithms. This review highlights the necessity of integrating LRS-based platforms, pangenome-based study designs, and graph-based pangenome references in short-read mapping and LRS-based innovations to achieve precision forensic science.
translated_keywords: 基因组多样性；长读长第三代测序；法医整合基因组学；范式转变；泛基因组参考
translated_abstract: 人类泛基因组参考联盟、中国泛基因组联盟以及其它动植物泛基因组项目宣布已完成试点研究工作，旨在构建能够代表全球不同民族语言群体或不同动植物物种的高质量单倍型解析参考图谱基因组。这些基于图谱且无缺口的泛基因组参考序列在基因组多样性、完整性和连续性方面得到了丰富，有望推动基于长读长测序（LRS）的基因组研究，并改善传统短读长测序平台上的可映射性和变异基因分型。本文全面讨论了基于泛基因组的整合基因组发现的进展，特别是在与法医学相关的物种（人、动物和植物）中的应用，总结了其在变异识别、法医学、表观遗传学、转录组学和微生物组研究中的应用。多重化阵列测序的最新发展引入了一种高效且可编程的技术，以克服LRS平台上短法医学标记长度的局限性。该技术可以将短RNA转录本和DNA片段连接成适合LRS的最优分子用于测序、组装和基因分型。新泛基因组参考坐标及其相应计算算法的整合将通过促进新标记的识别、精确基因分型、高分辨率面板开发和统计算法更新，使法医整合基因组学受益。本综述强调了在短读长映射和基于LRS的创新中整合基于LRS的平台、基于泛基因组的研究设计和基于图谱的泛基因组参考的必要性，以实现精准法医学。

translated_title: 分布式基因组参考的前景与挑战
affiliations: Laboratory of Ancient DNA, Department of Cultural Heritage, University of Bologna, Via degli Ariani 1, 48121 Ravenna, Italy.
title: Human Pangenomics: Promises and Challenges of a Distributed Genomic Reference.
authors: Abondio Paolo; Cilli Elisabetta; Luiselli Donata
keywords: public health; pangenomics; bioinformatics; evolution; human genomics; phylogenetics; pangenome; selection; personalized medicine; structural variation
abstract: A pangenome is a collection of the common and unique genomes that are present in a given species. It combines the genetic information of all the genomes sampled, resulting in a large and diverse range of genetic material. Pangenomic analysis offers several advantages compared to traditional genomic research. For example, a pangenome is not bound by the physical constraints of a single genome, so it can capture more genetic variability. Thanks to the introduction of the concept of pangenome, it is possible to use exceedingly detailed sequence data to study the evolutionary history of two different species, or how populations within a species differ genetically. In the wake of the Human Pangenome Project, this review aims at discussing the advantages of the pangenome around human genetic variation, which are then framed around how pangenomic data can inform population genetics, phylogenetics, and public health policy by providing insights into the genetic basis of diseases or determining personalized treatments, targeting the specific genetic profile of an individual. Moreover, technical limitations, ethical concerns, and legal considerations are discussed.
translated_keywords: 公共卫生；泛基因组学；生物信息学；进化；人类基因组学；系统发生学；泛基因组；选择；个性化医疗；结构变异
translated_abstract: 泛基因组是存在于某一特定物种中的共有和独特基因组的集合，它整合了所有采样基因组的遗传信息，从而形成一个庞大且多样的遗传物质库。与传统基因组学研究相比，泛基因组分析具有诸多优势。例如，泛基因组不受单一基因组物理限制的约束，因此能够捕获更多的遗传变异。得益于泛基因组概念的引入，可以利用极其详细的序列数据来研究两个不同物种的进化历史，或者探讨同一物种内群体间的遗传差异。在人类泛基因组计划之后，本文综述旨在讨论泛基因组在人类遗传变异方面的优势，并围绕泛基因组数据如何通过揭示疾病遗传基础或确定个性化治疗方案来为种群遗传学、系统发育学以及公共卫生政策提供指导展开论述。此外，还讨论了技术局限性、伦理问题及法律考量。

translated_title: 跨泛基因组的最大匹配高效算法
affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Johns Hopkins University.
title: Mumemto: efficient maximal matching across pangenomes.
authors: Shivakumar Vikram S; Langmead Ben
keywords: (Auto-generated) 多序列最大唯一匹配;泛基因组;核心基因组比对;结构变异;计算效率;可视化;同线性;生物信息学;分子生物学
abstract: Aligning genomes into common coordinates is central to pangenome analysis and construction, but it is also computationally expensive. Multi-sequence maximal unique matches (multi-MUMs) are guideposts for core genome alignments, helping to frame and solve the multiple alignment problem. We introduce Mumemto, a tool that computes multi-MUMs and other match types across large pangenomes. Mumemto allows for visualization of synteny, reveals aberrant assemblies and scaffolds, and highlights pangenome conservation and structural variation. Mumemto computes multi-MUMs across 320 human genome assemblies (960GB) in 25.7 hours with under 800 GB of memory, and over hundreds of fungal genome assemblies in minutes. Mumemto is implemented in C++ and Python and available open-source at https://github.com/vikshiv/mumemto.

title: A Draft Pacific Ancestry Pangenome Reference.
authors: Littlefield Connor; Lazaro-Guevara Jose M; Stucki Devorah; Lansford Michael; Pezzolesi Melissa H; Taylor Emma J; Wolfgramm Etoni-Ma'asi C; Taloa Jacob; Lao Kime; Dumaguit C Dave C; Ridge Perry G; Tavana Justina P; Holland William L; Raphael Kalani L; Pezzolesi Marcus G
keywords: (Auto-generated) Pacific ancestry; 基因组参考; 健康差异; 真阳性变异; 新序列; pangenome参考; 遗传分析; 生物信息学; 分子生物学
abstract: Individuals of Pacific ancestry suffer some of the highest rates of health disparities yet remain vastly underrepresented in genomic research, including currently available linear and pangenome references. To begin addressing this, we developed the first Pacific ancestry pangenome reference using 23 individuals with diverse Pacific ancestry. We assembled 46 haploid genomes from these 23 individuals, resulting in highly accurate and contiguous genome assemblies with an average quality value of 55.0 and an average N50 of 40.7 Mb, marking the first de novo assembly of highly accurate Pacific ancestry genomes. We combined these assemblies to create a pangenome reference, which added 30.6 Mb of novel sequence missing from the Human Pangenome Reference Consortium (HPRC) reference. Mapping short reads to this pangenome reduced variant call errors and yielded more true-positive variants compared to the HPRC and T2T-CHM13 references. This Pacific ancestry pangenome reference serves as a resource to enhance genetic analyses for this underserved population.
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
translated_keywords: Pacific ancestry; 基因组参考; 健康差异; 真阳性变异; 新序列; pangenome参考; 遗传分析; 生物信息学; 分子生物学
journal_full_name: bioRxiv: The Preprint Server for Biology
translated_abstract: 太平洋血统人群面临一些最高的健康差异率，但他们在基因组研究中的代表性仍然严重不足，包括目前可用的线性和泛基因组参考。为了解决这一问题，我们利用23名具有多样化太平洋血统的个体开发了首个太平洋血统泛基因组参考。从这23名个体中组装出46个单倍体基因组，得到了平均质量值为55.0且平均N50为40.7 Mb的高度准确且连续的基因组组装结果，标志着首次对高度准确的太平洋血统基因组进行从头组装。我们将这些组装结果结合起来创建了一个泛基因组参考，该参考增加了30.6 Mb的序列，这些序列在人类泛基因组参考联盟（HPRC）参考中缺失。与HPRC和T2T-CHM13参考相比，将短读映射到这个泛基因组减少了变异调用错误，并产生了更多的真阳性变异。这个太平洋血统泛基因组参考为增强对该服务不足人群的遗传分析提供了一种资源。

translated_title: 快速精确的泛基因组构建与核心基因组大小估算
affiliations: Faculty of Technology and Center for Biotechnology (CeBiTec), Bielefeld University, Bielefeld, 33615, Germany.; Department of Genetics, Genomics and Informatics, University of Tennessee Health Science Center, Memphis, TN 38163, USA.; Institute for Medical Biometry and Bioinformatics, Medical Faculty and University Hospital Düsseldorf, Heinrich Heine University Düsseldorf, Germany.; Center for Digital Medicine, Heinrich Heine University Düsseldorf, Germany.; Department for Endocrinology and Diabetology, Medical Faculty and University Hospital Düsseldorf, Heinrich Heine University Düsseldorf, Germany.; German Diabetes Center (DDZ), Leibniz Institute for Diabetes Research, Düsseldorf, Germany.
title: Panacus: fast and exact pangenome growth and core size estimation.
authors: Parmigiani Luca; Garrison Erik; Stoye Jens; Marschall Tobias; Doerr Daniel
keywords: (Auto-generated) Panacus; pangenome; 核心基因组; 基因组变异; 图模型; GFA文件; Rust语言; 生物信息学; 分子生物学
abstract: Using a single linear reference genome poses a limitation to exploring the full genomic diversity of a species. The release of a draft human pangenome underscores the increasing relevance of pangenomics to overcome these limitations. Pangenomes are commonly represented as graphs, which can represent billions of base pairs of sequence. Presently, there is a lack of scalable software able to perform key tasks on pangenomes, such as quantifying universally shared sequence across genomes (the core genome) and measuring the extent of genomic variability as a function of sample size (pangenome growth). We introduce Panacus (pangenome-abacus), a tool designed to rapidly perform these tasks and visualize the results in interactive plots. Panacus can process GFA files, the accepted standard for pangenome graphs, and is able to analyze a human pangenome graph with 110 million nodes in less than one hour. Panacus is implemented in Rust and is published as Open Source software under the MIT license. The source code and documentation are available at https://github.com/marschall-lab/panacus. Panacus can be installed via Bioconda at https://bioconda.github.io/recipes/panacus/README.html.

translated_title: I群和II群代表不同物种
affiliations: Institute for Global Food Security, School of Biological Sciences, Queen's University, Belfast, UK.; Department of Biosciences, School of Science and Technology, Nottingham Trent University, Nottingham, UK.; Wellcome Wolfson Institute for Experimental Medicine, School of Medicine, Dentistry and Biomedical Sciences, Queen's University Belfast, 97 Lisburn Road, Belfast, BT9 7BL, UK.
title: Genomic analyses of Bacteroides fragilis: subdivisions I and II represent distinct species.
authors: English Jamie; Newberry Fiona; Hoyles Lesley; Patrick Sheila; Stewart Linda
keywords: antimicrobial resistance; taxonomy; Bacteroidaceae
abstract: Introduction. Bacteroides fragilis is a Gram-negative anaerobe that is a member of the human gastrointestinal microbiota and is frequently found as an extra-intestinal opportunistic pathogen. B. fragilis comprises two distinct groups - divisions I and II - characterized by the presence/absence of genes [cepA and ccrA (cfiA), respectively] that confer resistance to β-lactam antibiotics by either serine or metallo-β-lactamase production. No large-scale analyses of publicly available B. fragilis sequence data have been undertaken, and the resistome of the species remains poorly defined.Hypothesis/Gap Statement. Reclassification of divisions I and II B. fragilis as two distinct species has been proposed but additional evidence is required.Aims. To investigate the genomic diversity of GenBank B. fragilis genomes and establish the prevalence of division I and II strains among publicly available B. fragilis genomes, and to generate further evidence to demonstrate that B. fragilis division I and II strains represent distinct genomospecies.Methodology. High-quality (n=377) genomes listed as B. fragilis in GenBank were included in pangenome and functional analyses. Genome data were also subject to resistome profiling using The Comprehensive Antibiotic Resistance Database.Results. Average nucleotide identity and phylogenetic analyses showed B. fragilis divisions I and II represent distinct species: B. fragilis sensu stricto (n=275 genomes) and B. fragilis A (n=102 genomes; Genome Taxonomy Database designation), respectively. Exploration of the pangenome of B. fragilis sensu stricto and B. fragilis A revealed separation of the two species at the core and accessory gene levels.Conclusion. The findings indicate that B. fragilis A, previously referred to as division II B. fragilis, is an individual species and distinct from B. fragilis sensu stricto. The B. fragilis pangenome analysis supported previous genomic, phylogenetic and resistome screening analyses collectively reinforcing that divisions I and II are two separate species. In addition, it was confirmed that differences in the accessory genes of B. fragilis divisions I and II are primarily associated with carbohydrate metabolism and suggest that differences other than antimicrobial resistance could also be used to distinguish between these two species.
translated_keywords: 抗菌耐药性；分类学；拟杆菌科
translated_abstract:
**摘要**  
**引言**：脆弱拟杆菌（*Bacteroides fragilis*）是一种革兰氏阴性厌氧菌，属于人体胃肠道微生物群的一部分，并常作为肠外机会性病原体被发现。脆弱拟杆菌分为两个不同的组别——第I组和第II组，其特征在于存在或缺失与β-内酰胺类抗生素耐药性相关的基因（分别为*cepA*和*ccrA*（*cfiA*））。目前尚未对公共数据库中可获得的脆弱拟杆菌序列数据进行大规模分析，该物种的抗性组仍定义不清。  
**假设/研究空白**：有提议将第I组和第II组脆弱拟杆菌重新分类为两个独立的物种，但需要更多证据支持这一观点。  
**目的**：本研究旨在调查GenBank中脆弱拟杆菌基因组的基因组多样性，并确定公共数据库中第I组和第II组菌株的流行率，同时生成进一步的证据以证明第I组和第II组脆弱拟杆菌代表了不同的基因组物种。  
**方法**：纳入了GenBank中标记为脆弱拟杆菌的高质量（n=377）基因组进行泛基因组和功能分析。此外，使用《综合抗生素抗性数据库》对基因组数据进行了抗性组谱分析。  
**结果**：平均核苷酸一致性（ANI）和系统发育分析表明，脆弱拟杆菌的第I组和第II组代表了两个不同的物种：严格意义上的脆弱拟杆菌（*B. fragilis* sensu stricto，n=275个基因组）和脆弱拟杆菌A（*B. fragilis* A，n=102个基因组；基因组分类数据库中的名称）。对严格意义上的脆弱拟杆菌和脆弱拟杆菌A的泛基因组探索显示，这两个物种在核心基因和辅助基因水平上均存在分离。  
**结论**：研究结果表明，以前被称为第II组脆弱拟杆菌的脆弱拟杆菌A是一个独立的物种，且不同于严格意义上的脆弱拟杆菌。脆弱拟杆菌的泛基因组分析支持了先前的基因组、系统发育和抗性组筛查分析，共同证实了第I组和第II组是两个独立的物种。此外，还确认了第I组和第II组脆弱拟杆菌的辅助基因差异主要与碳水化合物代谢相关，这表明除了抗菌素耐药性之外，其他差异也可能用于区分这两个物种。

translated_title: 鲍曼不动杆菌的自然宝库
affiliations: Microbiology Department, Papanikolaou General Hospital, 57010 Thessaloniki, Greece.; Microbiology Department, Agios Pavlos General Hospital, 55134 Thessaloniki, Greece.; Department of Microbiology, Shahr-e-Qods Branch, Islamic Azad University, Tehran 37541-374, Iran.
title: Pan-Genome Plasticity and Virulence Factors: A Natural Treasure Trove for Acinetobacter baumannii.
authors: Karampatakis Theodoros; Tsergouli Katerina; Behzadi Payam
keywords: genome; virulence factors; molecular pathogenicity; plasticity; Acinetobacter baumannii
abstract: Acinetobacter baumannii is a Gram-negative pathogen responsible for a variety of community- and hospital-acquired infections. It is recognized as a life-threatening pathogen among hospitalized individuals and, in particular, immunocompromised patients in many countries. A. baumannii, as a member of the ESKAPE group, encompasses high genomic plasticity and simultaneously is predisposed to receive and exchange the mobile genetic elements (MGEs) through horizontal genetic transfer (HGT). Indeed, A. baumannii is a treasure trove that contains a high number of virulence factors. In accordance with these unique pathogenic characteristics of A. baumannii, the authors aim to discuss the natural treasure trove of pan-genome and virulence factors pertaining to this bacterial monster and try to highlight the reasons why this bacterium is a great concern in the global public health system.
translated_keywords: 基因组；毒力因子；分子致病性；可塑性；鲍曼不动杆菌
translated_abstract: 鲍曼不动杆菌是一种革兰氏阴性病原体，可引起社区获得性和医院获得性感染。在许多国家，它被认为是危及生命的病原体，尤其对住院患者和免疫力低下的患者构成严重威胁。作为ESKAPE组的一员，鲍曼不动杆菌具有高度的基因组可塑性，并且容易通过水平基因转移（HGT）接收和交换移动遗传元件（MGEs）。事实上，鲍曼不动杆菌是一个包含大量毒力因子的宝库。根据鲍曼不动杆菌的独特致病特性，作者旨在讨论与这种细菌相关的泛基因组和毒力因子的天然宝库，并试图阐明为什么这种细菌在全球公共卫生系统中备受关注。

translated_title: 猪的泛基因组和基因组变异分析揭示了其适应性和农艺特性相关的基因组特征。
affiliations: Key Laboratory of Animal Genetics, Breeding and Reproduction of Shaanxi Province, Laboratory of Animal Fat Deposition & Muscle Development, College of Animal Science and Technology Northwest A&F University Yangling Shaanxi China.; State Key Laboratory of Animal Biotech Breeding National Engineering Laboratory for Animal Breeding, College of Animal Science and Technology China Agricultural University Beijing China.; Key Laboratory of Vertebrate Evolution and Human Origins Chinese Academy of Sciences Beijing China.; Institute of Subtropical Agriculture Chinese Academy of Sciences Changsha Hunan China.; Centre for Quantitative Genetics and Genomics Aarhus University Aarhus Denmark.; Department of Animal Science, College of Animal Science Zhejiang University Hangzhou China.; Sanya Institute Hainan Academy of Agricultural Science Sanya Hainan China.; Animal Breeding and Genomics Wageningen University and Research Wageningen The Netherlands.
title: Pangenome and genome variation analyses of pigs unveil genomic facets for their adaptation and agronomic characteristics.
authors: Li Dong; Wang Yulong; Yuan Tiantian; Cao Minghao; He Yulin; Zhang Lin; Li Xiang; Jiang Yifan; Li Ke; Sun Jingchun; Lv Guangquan; Su Guosheng; Wang Qishan; Pan Yuchun; Li Xinjian; Jiang Yu; Yang Gongshe; Groenen Martien A M; Derks Martijn F L; Ding Rongrong; Ding Xiangdong; Yu Taiyong
keywords: (Auto-generated) 猪;图谱泛基因组;结构变异;适应性;经济性状;肉质;BTF3;生物信息学;基因组学
abstract: The development of a comprehensive pig graph pangenome assembly encompassing 27 genomes represents the most extensive collection of pig genomic data to date. Analysis of this pangenome reveals the critical role of structural variations in driving adaptation and defining breed-specific traits. Notably, the study identifies BTF3 as a key candidate gene governing intramuscular fat deposition and meat quality in pigs. These findings underscore the power of pangenome approaches in uncovering novel genomic features underlying economically important agricultural traits. Collectively, these results demonstrate the value of leveraging large-scale, multi-genome analyses for advancing our understanding of livestock genomes and accelerating genetic improvement.
translated_keywords: 猪;图谱泛基因组;结构变异;适应性;经济性状;肉质;BTF3;生物信息学;基因组学
translated_abstract: 包含27个基因组的猪图谱泛基因组的构建代表了迄今为止最全面的猪基因组数据集。对这一泛基因组的分析揭示了结构变异在驱动适应和定义品种特异性特征中的关键作用。值得注意的是，研究确定BTF3是调控猪肌内脂肪沉积和肉质的重要候选基因。这些发现强调了泛基因组方法在揭示与重要经济性状相关的新型基因组特征方面的强大能力。总体而言，这些结果展示了利用大规模多基因组分析推进我们对家畜基因组的理解并加速遗传改良的价值。

translated_title: 大豆泛基因组研究的前沿
affiliations: Key Laboratory of Seed Innovation, Institute of Genetics and Development of Biology, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing 100101, China.; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing 101408, China.
title: Frontiers of soybean pan-genome studies.
authors: Liu Yu-Cheng; Shen Yan-Ting; Tian Zhi-Xi
keywords: soybean; evolution; domestication; structural variation; pan-genome
abstract: Artificial domestication provided the original motivation to the blooming of agriculture, following with the dramatic change of the genetic background of crops and livestock. According to theory and technology upgradation that contributing to the omics, we appreciate using the pan-genome instead of single reference genome for crop study. By comparison and integration of multiple genomes under the guidance of pan-genome theory, we can estimate the genomic information range of a species, leading to a global understanding of its genetic diversity. Combining pan-genome with large size chromosomal structural variations, high throughput population resequencing, and multi-omics data, we can profoundly study the genetic basis behind species traits we focus on. Soybean is one of the most important commercial crops over the world. It is also essential to our food security. Dissecting the formation of genetic diversity and the causal loci of key agricultural traits of soybean will make the modern soybean breeding more efficiently. In this review, we summarize the core idea of pan-genome and clarified the characteristics of construction strategies of pan-genome such as de novo/mapping assembly, iterative assembly and graph-based genome. Then we used the soybean pan-genome work as a case study to introduce the general way to study pan-genome. We highlighted the contribution of structural variation (SV) to the evolution/domestication of soybean and its value in understanding the genetic bases of agronomy traits. By those, we approved the value of graph-based pan-genome for data integration and SV calculation. Future research directions are also discussed for crop genomics and data science.
translated_keywords: 大豆；进化；驯化；结构变异；泛基因组
translated_abstract: 人工驯化为农业的蓬勃发展提供了最初的驱动力，并伴随着作物和家畜遗传背景的巨大变化。根据推动组学发展的理论和技术升级，我们认识到使用泛基因组而非单一参考基因组来研究作物的重要性。通过在泛基因组理论指导下对多个基因组进行比较和整合，我们可以估算一个物种的基因组信息范围，从而全面了解其遗传多样性。结合泛基因组、大规模染色体结构变异、高通量群体重测序以及多组学数据，可以深入研究我们关注的物种性状背后的遗传基础。大豆是全球最重要的商业作物之一，也是保障粮食安全的重要组成部分。解析大豆遗传多样性的形成机制及其关键农艺性状的因果位点，将显著提高现代大豆育种效率。本文综述了泛基因组的核心理念，并阐明了泛基因组构建策略（如从头组装/比对组装、迭代组装和基于图的基因组）的特点。随后以大豆泛基因组研究为例，介绍了泛基因组研究的一般方法。我们强调了结构变异（SV）在大豆进化/驯化中的贡献及其在理解农艺性状遗传基础方面的价值，从而证明了基于图的泛基因组在数据整合和SV计算中的重要性。此外，还讨论了作物基因组学和数据科学未来的研究方向。

translated_title: 通过反向疫苗学确定的百日咳博德特菌新型疫苗候选物
affiliations: Departamento de Microbiología, Escuela Nacional de Ciencias Biológicas, Instituto Politécnico Nacional (IPN), Mexico City, Mexico.; Departamento de Microbiología, Escuela Nacional de Ciencias Biológicas, Instituto Politécnico Nacional (IPN), Mexico City, Mexico. Electronic address: kdelgadillog@ipn.mx.
title: Novel vaccine candidates of Bordetella pertussis identified by reverse vaccinology.
authors: Monterrubio-López Gloria Paulina; Llamas-Monroy José Luis; Martínez-Gómez Ángel Antonio; Delgadillo-Gutiérrez Karen
keywords: Whooping cough; Vaccine; Reverse vaccinology; Bordetella
abstract: Whooping cough is a disease caused by Bordetella pertussis, whose morbidity has increased, motivating the improvement of current vaccines. Reverse vaccinology is a strategy that helps identify proteins with good characteristics fast and with fewer resources. In this work, we applied reverse vaccinology to study the B. pertussis proteome and pangenome with several in-silico tools. We analyzed the B. pertussis Tohama I proteome with NERVE software and compared 234 proteins with B. parapertussis, B. bronchiseptica, and B. holmessi. VaxiJen was used to calculate an antigenicity value; our threshold was 0.6, selecting 84 proteins. The candidates were depurated and grouped in eight family proteins to select representative candidates, according to bibliographic information and their immunological response predicted with ABCpred, Bcepred, IgPred, and C-ImmSim. Additionally, a pangenome study was conducted with 603 B. pertussis strains and PanRV software, identifying 3421 core proteins that were analyzed to select the best candidates. Finally, we selected 15 proteins from the proteome study and seven proteins from the pangenome analysis as good vaccine candidates.
journal: Biologicals : journal of the International Association of Biological Standardization
translated_keywords: 百日咳；疫苗；反向疫苗学；博德特氏菌
translated_abstract: 百日咳是由百日咳鲍特菌（Bordetella pertussis）引起的疾病，其发病率有所增加，促使当前疫苗的改进。反向疫苗学是一种能够快速且以较少资源识别具有良好特性蛋白的策略。本研究利用反向疫苗学方法，结合多种生物信息学工具对百日咳鲍特菌的蛋白质组和泛基因组进行了研究。我们使用NERVE软件分析了百日咳鲍特菌Tohama I株的蛋白质组，并将其与234种蛋白与副百日咳鲍特菌、支气管炎鲍特菌和霍姆斯鲍特菌进行比较。通过VaxiJen计算抗原性值，阈值设为0.6，筛选出84种蛋白。根据文献信息以及ABCpred、Bcepred、IgPred和C-ImmSim预测的免疫反应，这些候选蛋白被进一步筛选并分入八个蛋白家族，选择代表性候选蛋白。此外，还使用PanRV软件对603株百日咳鲍特菌菌株进行了泛基因组研究，鉴定出3421个核心蛋白，用于进一步筛选最佳候选蛋白。最终，从蛋白质组研究中选出15种蛋白，从泛基因组分析中选出7种蛋白作为优良的疫苗候选蛋白。

translated_title: 一种加速的FM索引
affiliations: Department of Computer and Information Science and Engineering, University of Florida, Gainesville, Florida, 32611, USA.; Faculty of Engineering, University of Yamanashi, Kōfu, 400-8510, Japan.; M &D Data Science Center, Tokyo Medical and Dental University, Tokyo, Japan.; Department of Computer and Information Science and Engineering, University of Florida, Gainesville, Florida, 32611, USA. christinaboucher@ufl.edu.; Faculty of Computer Science, Dalhousie University, Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada.
title: Pfp-fm: an accelerated FM-index.
authors: Hong Aaron; Oliva Marco; Köppl Dominik; Bannai Hideo; Boucher Christina; Gagie Travis
keywords: FM-index; Word-based indexing; Pangenomics; Random access
abstract: FM-indexes are crucial data structures in DNA alignment, but searching with them usually takes at least one random access per character in the query pattern. Ferragina and Fischer [1] observed in 2007 that word-based indexes often use fewer random accesses than character-based indexes, and thus support faster searches. Since DNA lacks natural word-boundaries, however, it is necessary to parse it somehow before applying word-based FM-indexing. In 2022, Deng et al. [2] proposed parsing genomic data by induced suffix sorting, and showed that the resulting word-based FM-indexes support faster counting queries than standard FM-indexes when patterns are a few thousand characters or longer. In this paper we show that using prefix-free parsing-which takes parameters that let us tune the average length of the phrases-instead of induced suffix sorting, gives a significant speedup for patterns of only a few hundred characters. We implement our method and demonstrate it is between 3 and 18 times faster than competing methods on queries to GRCh38, and is consistently faster on queries made to 25,000, 50,000 and 100,000 SARS-CoV-2 genomes. Hence, it seems our method accelerates the performance of count over all state-of-the-art methods with a moderate increase in the memory. The source code for PFP - FM is available at https://github.com/AaronHong1024/afm .

translated_title: 泛基因组核心检测方法
affiliations: Faculty of Technology and Center for Biotechnology, Bielefeld University, Bielefeld, Germany.; Faculty of Technology and Center for Biotechnology, Bielefeld University, Bielefeld, Germany. jens.stoye@uni-bielefeld.de.
title: Methods for Pangenomic Core Detection.
authors: Schulz Tizian; Parmigiani Luca; Rempel Andreas; Stoye Jens
keywords: k-mer-based methods; Comparative genomics; Pangenomics; Core genome analysis
abstract: Computational pangenomics deals with the joint analysis of all genomic sequences of a species. It has already been successfully applied to various tasks in many research areas. Further advances in DNA sequencing technologies constantly let more and more genomic sequences become available for many species, leading to an increasing attractiveness of pangenomic studies. At the same time, larger datasets also pose new challenges for data structures and algorithms that are needed to handle the data. Efficient methods oftentimes make use of the concept of k-mers.Core detection is a common way of analyzing a pangenome. The pangenome's core is defined as the subset of genomic information shared among all individual members. Classically, it is not only determined on the abstract level of genes but can also be described on the sequence level.In this chapter, we provide an overview of k-mer-based methods in the context of pangenomics studies. We first revisit existing software solutions for k-mer counting and k-mer set representation. Afterward, we describe the usage of two k-mer-based approaches, Pangrowth and Corer, for pangenomic core detection.
translated_keywords: 基于k-mer的方法；比较基因组学；泛基因组学；核心基因组分析
translated_abstract:
计算泛基因组学涉及对一个物种所有基因组序列的联合分析，已在许多研究领域的各种任务中得到成功应用。DNA测序技术的进一步发展使得越来越多的物种基因组序列得以获取，这极大地提升了泛基因组研究的吸引力。然而，更大的数据集也给处理这些数据所需的数据结构和算法带来了新的挑战。高效的泛基因组学方法通常利用k-mer的概念。核心检测是泛基因组分析的一种常见方式，其核心被定义为在所有个体成员中共有的基因组信息子集。经典的核心检测不仅可以在基因的抽象层面上进行，还可以在序列层面上描述。

本章综述了基于k-mer的方法在泛基因组学研究中的应用。首先回顾了现有的k-mer计数和k-mer集合表示的软件解决方案，随后描述了两种基于k-mer的方法（Pangrowth和Corer）在泛基因组核心检测中的应用。

translated_title: 泛基因组图上的共线链式分析
affiliations: Department of Computational and Data Sciences, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, Karnataka, India.; Department of Computational and Data Sciences, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore, 560012, Karnataka, India. chirag@iisc.ac.in.
title: Co-linear chaining on pangenome graphs.
authors: Rajput Jyotshna; Chandra Ghanshyam; Jain Chirag
keywords: Variation graph; Genome sequencing; Path cover; Sequence alignment
abstract: Pangenome reference graphs are useful in genomics because they compactly represent the genetic diversity within a species, a capability that linear references lack. However, efficiently aligning sequences to these graphs with complex topology and cycles can be challenging. The seed-chain-extend based alignment algorithms use co-linear chaining as a standard technique to identify a good cluster of exact seed matches that can be combined to form an alignment. Recent works show how the co-linear chaining problem can be efficiently solved for acyclic pangenome graphs by exploiting their small width and how incorporating gap cost in the scoring function improves alignment accuracy. However, it remains open on how to effectively generalize these techniques for general pangenome graphs which contain cycles. Here we present the first practical formulation and an exact algorithm for co-linear chaining on cyclic pangenome graphs. We rigorously prove the correctness and computational complexity of the proposed algorithm. We evaluate the empirical performance of our algorithm by aligning simulated long reads from the human genome to a cyclic pangenome graph constructed from 95 publicly available haplotype-resolved human genome assemblies. While the existing heuristic-based algorithms are faster, the proposed algorithm provides a significant advantage in terms of accuracy. Implementation ( https://github.com/at-cg/PanAligner ).

authors: Hong Aaron; Oliva Marco; Köppl Dominik; Bannai Hideo; Boucher Christina; Gagie Travis

[2] proposed parsing genomic data by induced suffix sorting, and showed the resulting word-based FM-indexes support faster counting queries than standard FM-indexes when patterns are a few thousand characters or longer. In this paper we show that using prefix-free parsing-which takes parameters that let us tune the average length of the phrases-instead of induced suffix sorting, gives a significant speedup for patterns of only a few hundred characters. translated_title: 解析作物基因与基因组结构、功能及进化的资源与工具概述
affiliations: Department of Botany and Plant Pathology, Oregon State University, Corvallis, OR 97331, USA.; Molecular & Digital Breeing Group, New Cultivar Innovation, The New Zealand Institute for Plant and Food Research Limited, Private Bag 92169, Auckland 1142, New Zealand.; State Key Laboratory of Agricultural Genomics, Key Laboratory of Genomics, Ministry of Agriculture, BGI Research, Shenzhen 518083, China.
title: Exploring Pan-Genomes: An Overview of Resources and Tools for Unraveling Structure, Function, and Evolution of Crop Genes and Genomes.
authors: Naithani Sushma; Deng Cecilia H; Sahu Sunil Kumar; Jaiswal Pankaj
keywords: gravitropism; gene ontology; gene annotation; pan-genomes; plant pathways; comparative genomics
abstract: The availability of multiple sequenced genomes from a single species made it possible to explore intra- and inter-specific genomic comparisons at higher resolution and build clade-specific pan-genomes of several crops. The pan-genomes of crops constructed from various cultivars, accessions, landraces, and wild ancestral species represent a compendium of genes and structural variations and allow researchers to search for the novel genes and alleles that were inadvertently lost in domesticated crops during the historical process of crop domestication or in the process of extensive plant breeding. Fortunately, many valuable genes and alleles associated with desirable traits like disease resistance, abiotic stress tolerance, plant architecture, and nutrition qualities exist in landraces, ancestral species, and crop wild relatives. The novel genes from the wild ancestors and landraces can be introduced back to high-yielding varieties of modern crops by implementing classical plant breeding, genomic selection, and transgenic/gene editing approaches. Thus, pan-genomic represents a great leap in plant research and offers new avenues for targeted breeding to mitigate the impact of global climate change. Here, we summarize the tools used for pan-genome assembly and annotations, web-portals hosting plant pan-genomes, etc. Furthermore, we highlight a few discoveries made in crops using the pan-genomic approach and future potential of this emerging field of study.
translated_keywords: gravitropism（向重力性）；gene ontology（基因本体论）；gene annotation（基因注释）；pan-genomes（泛基因组）；plant pathways（植物代谢通路）；comparative genomics（比较基因组学）
translated_abstract: 单个物种的多个全基因组序列的可用性使得以更高的分辨率探索种内和种间基因组比较成为可能，并且可以构建几种作物的谱系特异性泛基因组。由各种栽培品种、品系、地方品种以及野生祖先种构建的作物泛基因组代表了一组基因和结构变异的总和，使研究者能够寻找在作物驯化历史过程或广泛的植物育种过程中无意丢失的新型基因和等位基因。幸运的是，与抗病性、非生物胁迫耐受性、植物形态以及营养品质等理想性状相关的许多有价值基因和等位基因存在于地方品种、祖先种和作物野生近缘种中。通过实施经典植物育种、基因组选择以及转基因/基因编辑方法，可以从野生祖先和地方品种中重新引入新的基因到现代高产作物品种中。因此，泛基因组学代表了植物研究的一大进步，并为有针对性的育种提供了新途径，以缓解全球气候变化的影响。本文综述了用于泛基因组组装和注释的工具、托管植物泛基因组的网络门户等内容。此外，我们还强调了利用泛基因组学方法在作物中取得的一些发现及其研究领域的未来潜力。

translated_title: 神经退行性疾病研究的新纪元
affiliations: Laboratory of Ancient DNA, Department of Cultural Heritage, University of Bologna, Via degli Ariani 1, 48121 Ravenna, Italy. Electronic address: paolo.abondio2@unibo.it.; Academy of Cognitive Behavioral Sciences of Calabria (ASCoC), Lamezia Terme, Italy; Regional Neurogenetic Centre (CRN), Department of Primary Care, Azienda Sanitaria Provinciale Di Catanzaro, Viale A. Perugini, 88046 Lamezia Terme, CZ, Italy; Association for Neurogenetic Research (ARN), Lamezia Terme, CZ, Italy.; Department of Biology, Ecology and Earth Sciences, University of Calabria, Rende 87036, Italy.; Laboratory of Ancient DNA, Department of Cultural Heritage, University of Bologna, Via degli Ariani 1, 48121 Ravenna, Italy.
title: Pangenomics: A new era in the field of neurodegenerative diseases.
authors: Abondio Paolo; Bruno Francesco; Passarino Giuseppe; Montesanto Alberto; Luiselli Donata
keywords: Behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD); Pangenomics; Alzheimer’s disease; Neurodegenerative diseases, neurodegeneration; Dementia
abstract: A pangenome is composed of all the genetic variability of a group of individuals, and its application to the study of neurodegenerative diseases may provide valuable insights into the underlying aspects of genetic heterogenetiy for these complex ailments, including gene expression, epigenetics, and translation mechanisms. Furthermore, a reference pangenome allows for the identification of previously undetected structural commonalities and differences among individuals, which may help in the diagnosis of a disease, support the prediction of what will happen over time (prognosis) and aid in developing novel treatments in the perspective of personalized medicine. Therefore, in the present review, the application of the pangenome concept to the study of neurodegenerative diseases will be discussed and analyzed for its potential to enable an improvement in diagnosis and prognosis for these illnesses, leading to the development of tailored treatments for individual patients from the knowledge of the genomic composition of a whole population.
translated_keywords: 痴呆的行为与心理症状（BPSD）；泛基因组学；阿尔茨海默病；神经退行性疾病，神经退行性变；痴呆
translated_abstract: 泛基因组由一组个体的所有遗传变异组成，将其应用于神经退行性疾病的研究可能有助于深入了解这些复杂疾病在基因表达、表观遗传学以及翻译机制等方面的遗传异质性。此外，参考泛基因组能够识别个体之间之前未被发现的结构共同点和差异，这可能有助于疾病的诊断、支持对疾病进展（预后）的预测，并在个性化医疗的视角下助力开发新的治疗方法。因此，在本综述中，我们将讨论并分析泛基因组概念在神经退行性疾病研究中的应用潜力，探讨其如何改善这些疾病的诊断与预后，并基于整个群体的基因组构成知识，为个体患者制定针对性治疗方案提供支持。

translated_title: 采用先插补方法以最小化参考偏差
affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Johns Hopkins University.
title: Minimizing Reference Bias with an Impute-First Approach.
authors: Vaddadi Kavya; Mun Taher; Langmead Ben
keywords: (Auto-generated) 个性化参考;基因分型;参考偏倚;全基因组测序;变异检测;精准医学;生物信息学
abstract: Pangenome indexes reduce reference bias in sequencing data analysis. However, bias can be reduced further by using a personalized reference, e.g. a diploid human reference constructed to match a donor individual's alleles. We present a novel impute-first alignment framework that combines elements of genotype imputation and pangenome alignment. It begins by genotyping the individual using only a subsample of the input reads. It next uses a reference panel and efficient imputation algorithm to impute a personalized diploid reference. Finally, it indexes the personalized reference and applies a read aligner, which could be a linear or graph aligner, to align the full read set to the personalized reference. This framework achieves higher variant-calling recall (99.54% vs. 99.37%), precision (99.36% vs. 99.18%), and F1 (99.45% vs. 99.28%) compared to a graph pangenome aligner. The personalized reference is also smaller and faster to query compared to a pangenome index, making it an overall advantageous choice for whole-genome DNA sequencing experiments.
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
translated_keywords: 个性化参考;基因分型;参考偏倚;全基因组测序;变异检测;精准医学;生物信息学
journal_full_name: bioRxiv: The Preprint Server for Biology
translated_abstract: 泛基因组索引可以减少测序数据分析中的参考偏倚，但通过使用个性化参考（例如，与供体个体等位基因相匹配的二倍体人类参考）可以进一步降低偏倚。我们提出了一种新颖的先验预测后比对框架，结合了基因型预测和泛基因组比对的元素。该框架首先仅使用输入读取数据的一个子样本来对个体进行基因分型。接着，利用参考面板和高效的预测算法构建个性化的二倍体参考。最后，对该个性化参考进行索引，并应用线性或图比对器以将完整的读取数据集比对到个性化参考上。与泛基因组比对器相比，该框架在变异检测召回率（99.54% 对 99.37%）、精确度（99.36% 对 99.18%）和F1分数（99.45% 对 99.28%）方面表现更优。此外，与泛基因组索引相比，个性化参考更小且查询速度更快，因此对于全基因组DNA测序实验而言，它是一种总体上更有优势的选择。

translated_title: 新的基因组测序资源可能改善护理质量。
title: New Genomic Sequencing Resource Could Improve Care.
keywords: (Auto-generated) 人类基因组;pangenomic参考;biogeographic多样性;疾病筛查;癌症疗法;遗传多样性;精准医疗;生物信息学;分子生物学
abstract: The first draft of a human pangenomic reference, which includes 47 individuals selected to maximize biogeographic diversity, offers a path to more accurate and effective screening for disease. This broader and more complete view of genetic diversity could lead to new targets for cancer therapies.

title: Comparative genomics of Vibrio toranzoniae strains.
authors: Barcia-Cruz Rubén; Balboa Sabela; Lema Alberto; Romalde Jesús L
keywords: Virulence genes; Genome sequencing; Vibrio toranzoniae; Phylogenomics
abstract: Vibrio toranzoniae is a marine bacterium belonging to the Splendidus clade that was originally isolated from healthy clams in Galicia (NW Spain). Its isolation from different hosts and seawater indicated two lifestyles and wide geographical distribution. The aim of the present study was to determine the differences at the genomic level among six strains (4 isolated from clam and 2 from seawater) and to determine their phylogeny. For this purpose, whole genomes of the six strains were sequenced by different technologies including Illumina and PacBio, and the resulting sequences were corrected. Genomes were annotated and compared using different online tools. Furthermore, the study of core- and pan-genomes were examined, and the phylogeny was inferred. The content of the core genome ranged from 2953 to 2766 genes and that of the pangenome ranged from 6278 to 6132, depending on the tool used. Although the strains shared certain homology, with DDH values ranging from 77.10 to 82.30 and values of OrthoANI values higher than 97%, some differences were found related to motility, capsule synthesis, iron acquisition systems or mobile genetic elements. Phylogenetic analysis of the core genome did not reveal a differentiation of the strains according to their lifestyle (commensal or free-living), but that of the pangenome indicated certain geographical isolation in the same growing area. This study led to the reclassification of some isolates formerly described as V. toranzoniae and demonstrated the importance of cured deposited sequences to proper phylogenetic assignment.
journal: International microbiology : the official journal of the Spanish Society for Microbiology
translated_keywords: 毒力基因；基因组测序；河岸弧菌；系统基因组学
translated_abstract: 副溶血弧菌 *toranzoniae* 是一种属于Splendidus分支的海洋细菌，最初从西班牙西北部加利西亚地区的健康蛤蜊中分离得到。该菌株在不同宿主（包括蛤蜊和海水）中的分离表明其具有两种生活方式及广泛的地理分布。本研究旨在确定六株菌株（其中四株来自蛤蜊，两株来自海水）在基因组水平上的差异，并分析其系统发育关系。为此，采用Illumina和PacBio等不同技术对这六株菌株的全基因组进行了测序，并对所得序列进行了校正。通过多种在线工具对基因组进行注释与比较。此外，还研究了核心基因组和泛基因组的内容，并推断了系统发育关系。根据所用工具的不同，核心基因组的基因数量范围为2766至2953个，而泛基因组的基因数量范围为6132至6278个。尽管这些菌株之间存在一定的同源性，其DNA-DNA杂交值（DDH）介于77.10%到82.30%之间，OrthoANI值高于97%，但仍然发现了一些差异，涉及运动能力、荚膜合成、铁获取系统或可移动遗传元件等方面。基于核心基因组的系统发育分析并未显示菌株根据其生活方式（共生或自由生活）分化，但基于泛基因组的分析表明，在同一生长区域内存在一定的地理隔离现象。本研究重新分类了先前描述为 *V. toranzoniae* 的一些分离株，并证明了已存入数据库的高质量序列对于正确进行系统发育分类的重要性。

translated_title: 基于标记阵列的泛基因组基因分型
affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD, USA.; Department of Computer Science, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD, USA. langmea@cs.jhu.edu.
title: Pangenomic genotyping with the marker array.
authors: Mun Taher; Vaddadi Naga Sai Kavya; Langmead Ben
keywords: Sequence alignment; Indexing; Genotyping
abstract: We present a new method and software tool called rowbowt that applies a pangenome index to the problem of inferring genotypes from short-read sequencing data. The method uses a novel indexing structure called the marker array. Using the marker array, we can genotype variants with respect from large panels like the 1000 Genomes Project while reducing the reference bias that results when aligning to a single linear reference. rowbowt can infer accurate genotypes in less time and memory compared to existing graph-based methods. The method is implemented in the open source software tool rowbowt available at https://github.com/alshai/rowbowt .

translated_title: 尿路致病 Klebsiella spp. 的全基因组序列、表型相关性及泛基因组分析
affiliations: Actinomycetes Bioprospecting Lab, Centre for Research in Infectious Diseases (CRID), School of Chemical and Biotechnology (SCBT), SASTRA Deemed University, Tirumalaisamudram, Thanjavur, 613401, Tamil Nadu, India.; Microbial Omics Lab, Centre for Research in Infectious Diseases (CRID), School of Chemical and Biotechnology (SCBT), SASTRA Deemed University, Tirumalaisamudram, Thanjavur, 613401, Tamil Nadu, India.; Center for Tropical and Emerging Global Diseases (CTEGD), University of Georgia, Georgia, Athens, United States of America.; Actinomycetes Bioprospecting Lab, Centre for Research in Infectious Diseases (CRID), School of Chemical and Biotechnology (SCBT), SASTRA Deemed University, Tirumalaisamudram, Thanjavur, 613401, Tamil Nadu, India. antibioticbiology@gmail.com.
title: Complete genome sequence, phenotypic correlation and pangenome analysis of uropathogenic Klebsiella spp.
authors: Sundaresan Abhirami Krishnamoorthy; Gangwar Jaya; Murugavel Aravind; Malli Mohan Ganesh Babu; Ramakrishnan Jayapradha
keywords: Pangenome; Uropathogen; Genotype-Phenotype association; Klebsiella spp.,; Hypervirulence
abstract: Urinary tract infections (UTI) by antibiotic resistant and virulent K. pneumoniae are a growing concern. Understanding the genome and validating the genomic profile along with pangenome analysis will facilitate surveillance of high-risk clones of K. pneumoniae to underpin management strategies toward early detection. The present study aims to correlate resistome with phenotypic antimicrobial resistance and virulome with pathogenicity in Klebsiella spp. The present study aimed to perform complete genome sequences of Klebsiella spp. and to analyse the correlation of resistome with phenotypic antimicrobial resistance and virulome with pathogenicity. To understand the resistome, pangenome and virulome in the Klebsiella spp, the ResFinder, CARD, IS Finder, PlasmidFinder, PHASTER, Roary, VFDB were used. The phenotypic susceptibility profiling identified the uropathogenic kp3 to exhibit multi drug resistance. The resistome and in vitro antimicrobial profiling showed concordance with all the tested antibiotics against the study strains. Hypermucoviscosity was not observed for any of the test isolates; this phenotypic character matches perfectly with the absence of rmpA and magA genes. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first report on the presence of ste, stf, stc and sti major fimbrial operons of Salmonella enterica serotype Typhimurium in K. pneumoniae genome. The study identifies the discordance of virulome and virulence in Klebsiella spp. The complete genome analysis and phenotypic correlation identify uropathogenic K. pneumoniae kp3 as a carbapenem-resistant and virulent pathogen. The Pangenome of K. pneumoniae was open suggesting high genetic diversity. Diverse K serotypes were observed. Sequence typing reveals the prevalence of K. pneumoniae high-risk clones in UTI catheterised patients. The study also highlights the concordance of resistome and in vitro susceptibility tests. Importantly, the study identifies the necessity of virulome and phenotypic virulence markers for timely diagnosis and immediate treatment for the management of high-risk K. pneumoniae clones.
translated_keywords: 泛基因组；尿路致病菌；基因型-表型关联；克雷伯菌属；超毒力
translated_abstract: 由耐药且具毒力的肺炎克雷伯菌（K. pneumoniae）引起的尿路感染（UTI）正成为一个日益严重的关注点。理解基因组并验证基因组特征，同时进行泛基因组分析，将有助于对肺炎克雷伯菌高风险克隆的监测，从而为早期检测和管理策略提供支持。本研究旨在探讨肺炎克雷伯菌属的耐药组与表型抗微生物耐药性以及毒力组与致病性的相关性。研究目标是完成肺炎克雷伯菌属的全基因组测序，并分析耐药组与表型抗微生物耐药性以及毒力组与致病性的相关性。为了了解肺炎克雷伯菌属的耐药组、泛基因组和毒力组，使用了ResFinder、CARD、IS Finder、PlasmidFinder、PHASTER、Roary和VFDB等工具。表型敏感性分析显示，尿路致病性kp3表现出多重药物耐药性。耐药组和体外抗微生物分析表明，所有测试抗生素均与研究菌株一致。未观察到任何测试分离株的高粘液表型；这一表型特征与rmpA和magA基因的缺失完全吻合。据我们所知，这是首次报道在肺炎克雷伯菌基因组中存在鼠伤寒沙门氏菌血清型Typhimurium的主要菌毛操纵子ste、stf、stc和sti。研究发现肺炎克雷伯菌属的毒力组与其毒力之间存在不一致性。全基因组分析和表型相关性确定尿路致病性肺炎克雷伯菌kp3为碳青霉烯类耐药且具毒力的病原体。肺炎克雷伯菌的泛基因组呈开放状态，表明其具有较高的遗传多样性。观察到了多种K血清型。序列分型揭示了导管相关尿路感染患者中肺炎克雷伯菌高风险克隆的流行情况。研究还强调了耐药组与体外敏感性测试的一致性。尤为重要的是，研究指出了毒力组和表型毒力标志物对于及时诊断和快速治疗高风险肺炎克雷伯菌克隆的重要性。

Chan School of Public Health, Harvard University, Boston, Massachusetts, USA.; Department of Microbiology, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, Champaign, Illinois, USA.; Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences, University of Central Florida, Orlando, Florida, USA.; Department of International Health, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, Baltimore, Maryland, USA.
title: Linkage-based ortholog refinement in bacterial pangenomes with CLARC.
authors: González Ojeda Indra; Palace Samantha G; Martinez Pamela P; Azarian Taj; Grant Lindsay R; Hammitt Laura L; Hanage William P; Lipsitch Marc
keywords: Ortholog; Pangenome; Pipeline; Clustering; Roary; S. pneumonia; Bacteria; Accessory genes
abstract: Bacterial genomes exhibit significant variation in gene content and sequence identity. Pangenome analyses explore this diversity by classifying genes into core and accessory clusters of orthologous groups (COGs). However, strict sequence identity cutoffs can misclassify divergent alleles as different genes, inflating accessory gene counts. CLARC (Connected Linkage and Alignment Redefinition of COGs) [https://github.com/IndraGonz/CLARC] improves pangenome analyses by condensing accessory COGs using functional annotation and linkage information. Through this approach, orthologous groups are consolidated into more practical units of selection. Analyzing 8,000+ Streptococcus pneumoniae genomes, CLARC reduced accessory gene estimates by more than 30% and improved evolutionary predictions based on accessory gene frequencies. By refining COG definitions, CLARC offers critical insights into bacterial evolution, aiding genetic studies across diverse populations.
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
translated_keywords: 同源物；泛基因组；流程；聚类；Roary；肺炎链球菌；细菌；附属基因
journal_full_name: bioRxiv: The Preprint Server for Biology
translated_abstract: //github.com/IndraGonz/CLARC] 通过利用功能注释和连接信息来压缩辅助COGs，从而改进了泛基因组分析。这种方法将直系同源群整合为更实用的选择单位。通过对8,000多株肺炎链球菌基因组进行分析，CLARC将辅助基因的估计数量减少了30%以上，并基于辅助基因频率提高了进化预测的准确性。通过精确定义COGs，CLARC为细菌进化提供了关键见解，有助于不同群体中的遗传学研究。

translated_title: 基于路径引导随机梯度下降的泛基因组图布局
affiliations: Quantitative Biology Center (QBiC), University of Tübingen, Tübingen 72076, Germany.; Biomedical Data Science, Department of Computer Science, University of Tübingen, Tübingen 72076, Germany.; Department of Genetics, Genomics and Informatics, University of Tennessee Health Science Center, Memphis, TN 38163, USA.; Genomics Research Centre, Human Technopole, Milan 20157, Italy.; Department of Computer Engineering, School of Computation, Information and Technology (CIT), Technical University of Munich, Munich 80333, Germany.; School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Cornell University, Ithaca, NY 14853, USA.; Computomics GmbH, Eisenbahnstr. 1, 72072 Tübingen, Germany.; M3 Research Center, University Hospital Tübingen, 72076 Tübingen, Germany.
title: Pangenome graph layout by Path-Guided Stochastic Gradient Descent.
authors: Heumos Simon; Guarracino Andrea; Schmelzle Jan-Niklas M; Li Jiajie; Zhang Zhiru; Hagmann Jörg; Nahnsen Sven; Prins Pjotr; Garrison Erik
keywords: (Auto-generated) Pangenome图;路径引导;随机梯度下降;图布局算法;基因组变异;低维嵌入;生物特征揭示;生物信息学;分子生物学
abstract: The increasing availability of complete genomes demands for models to study genomic variability within entire populations. Pangenome graphs capture the full genomic similarity and diversity between multiple genomes. In order to understand them, we need to see them. For visualization, we need a human readable graph layout: A graph embedding in low (e.g. two) dimensional depictions. Due to a pangenome graph's potential excessive size, this is a significant challenge. In response, we introduce a novel graph layout algorithm: the Path-Guided Stochastic Gradient Descent (PG-SGD). PG-SGD uses the genomes, represented in the pangenome graph as paths, as an embedded positional system to sample genomic distances between pairs of nodes. This avoids the quadratic cost seen in previous versions of graph drawing by Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD). We show that our implementation efficiently computes the low dimensional layouts of gigabase-scale pangenome graphs, unveiling their biological features. We integrated PG-SGD in ODGI which is released as free software under the MIT open source license. Source code is available at https://github.com/pangenome/odgi.
